review_title: Good place to start your career
job_title: Junior Web Developer in New York, NY
pros:
I met a lot of good people while working at ATS, a lot of whom I still talk to on occasion. My managers and upper management were friendly and easy to talk to.

It was a good place to work straight out of college. I was given a lot of autonomy on my projects, so I was able to try a lot of new technologies. I was exposed to a lot of different types of projects.
cons:
Committees had a little too much influence over project details. At review points, committees would be exceedingly slow to respond, but would expect project deadlines to not change.

Things at ATS can occasionally get a little political. I was shielded from a lot of it, but I was aware of it.

job_title: Senior Director in New York, NY
pros: Good pay, good benefits, free tea and coffee, also the members/doctors are wonderful to work with
cons: Lack of business ethics, very discriminatory towards women. Cutbacks and layoffs were primarily of older, female employees. Steady and increasing layoffs and cutbacks with fabricated justifications. Heavy, intrusive surveillance of employees via Cognos reports, monitoring email and phone calls, and surveillance cameras in all "public" spaces, time clocks for punching in and out even if you are high-level salaried employee, and monitors who watch and note what time you come and go for lunch hour. This was all setup to "catch" employees so they could be laid off without severance.
